node.label: Input
node.description: The input signal to be processed.

node.label: Video out
node.description: The input signal to be processed.

object.script:
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
numbers={} bools={}
function onTick() for i=1,32 do bools[i]=gb(i) numbers[i]=gn(i) end end
function boolstr(b) if b then return "true" else return "false" end end
function onDraw() w = screen.getWidth() h = screen.getHeight() screen.setColor(0, 0, 0) screen.drawClear() screen.setColor(0,255,0)
local txt="" for i=1,32 do txt=txt .. string.format("%.0f:%.0f ", i, numbers[i]) end
txt=txt .. "\n"
for i=1,32 do txt=txt .. string.format("%.0f:%s ", i, boolstr(bools[i])) end
screen.drawTextBox(0,0,w,h,txt) end

node.label: Speed in
node.description: The input signal to be processed.

object.script:
inf=1/0
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function sn(n,v) output.setNumber(n,v) end
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
function sb(n,v) output.setBool(n,v) end
-- TV Guided version -- -- Ordnance telemetry protocol (output) -- We overlay the contact age field since I never found it to work anyway -- These fields are optional and the booleans specify whether the piece of ordnance provides them -- Boolean 9: Lock ordinal: If true, Numeric 4 contains the contact ordinal of the locked or targeted contact -- Boolean 10: FOV: If true, Number 8 contains the FOV of the weapon's sensors for drawing a targeting ring -- on the HUD -- Boolean 11 Range. Offer sensor range on Numeric 12 to draw a ring on the radar -- Boolean 12 Velocity on Numeric 20 -- Boolean 13 Compass on Numeric 24
-- Number 4: Ordinal of lock-on contact. In the case of stock missile radar heads, it's always the closest contact -- Number 8: FOV so that it can be displayed on the HUD -- Number 12: Weapon sensor/targeting range in meters -- Number 16: Reserved for ordnance type read from hardpoint and inserted later by MCU -- Number 20: Velocity -- Number 24: Compass -- Number 32: Reserved for radar MCU to track radar display scale/radius in m
-- Protocol (input) -- Numeric 1: Yaw command -- Numeric 2: Unused roll command -- Numeric 3: Pitch -- Numeric 4: Unused vertical command -- Numeric 5: RX freq (TX=RX+1)
-- Numeric 32: Hardpoint #/bus address -- Boolean 1: Launch (applied also to hardpoint) -- Boolean 9: Enable the weapon's sensors (radar etc.) which should use the game's standard radar -- protocol to report contacts on the composite-out. -- Check gb(9) to see whether the pilot is scanning for a target.
function onTick()
local range=inf local nearest=0 local r local present
scan=gb(9)
if not scan then return end
--[[ for i=1,8,1 do present = gb(i) sb(i,present) if present then r=gn(i*4-3) if r < range and r > 100 then -- Assume that anything inside 100m is self-detection range=r nearest=i end end end ]]
for i=1,32,1 do sn(i,gn(i)) end
sb(9,false) -- Notify we will report a target ordinal sb(10,false) -- Notify we will report sensor/radar FOV sb(11,false) -- Notify we will provide sensor range sb(12,true) -- Speed sb(13,true) -- Compass
-- sn(4,nearest) -- sn(8,20) -- Roughly 20 degrees -- sn(12,2000) -- 2km gives about a 20 degree X/Y FOV. Should match the radar head configuration. end
function onDraw() end
